newsitem.title: SWEDEN: More expensive meat boosts Swedish PPI in May.
newsitem.headline: More expensive meat boosts Swedish PPI in May.

text.p: Swedish producer prices for domestic sales in May rose sharply because of higher meat prices, Statistics Sweden said on Thursday.

Statistics Sweden said earlier that Swedish producer prices rose 0.7 percent in May for a year-on-year rise of 1.4 percent compared to market expectations of a monthly rise of 0.3 percent and a 12 month increase of 1.1 percent.
Behind this figure was a 0.9 percent rise in producer prices for home sales in May compared to April, which was the largest monthly rise in this figure since early 1995.
However Statistics Sweden said higher meat prices were behind a large part of the hike.
"Higher prices on meat and meat products were behind 0.4 percentage points of the increase," Statistics Sweden said in a statement.
Export prices rose 0.4 percent from April to May because of higher prices on pulp and forestry products.
Import prices rose on average 0.2 percent in May from April. Higher prices on petroleum accounted for 0.3 percentage points of this rise.
